circumstances: After takeoff from the gravel airstrip at Anchorage-Lake Hood, the single engine airplane encountered difficulties to gain height. It struck a lumber stack, a fence and crashed in flames onto a parking lot where five cars were damaged. The pilot, sole on board, was killed. He was en route to Aniak on a cargo flight.
probable_cause:
Inadequate preflight preparation on part of the pilot. The following contributing factors were reported:
- Failed to maintain flying speed, 
- Lack of familiarity with aircraft,
- Improperly loaded aircraft,
- Incorrect trim setting, 
- Aircraft at least 484 lbs over max gross weight.
